result.execSummary:
The defendant Blaine Christopher Glynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/full time schooling or a combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, he must perform 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blaine Christopher Glynn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:40pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/pro se.
VRCW


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (IID Tampering)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 Year Probation.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, he must perform 10 hours of C.S. per week; $150 + CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

Adj: 1:48pm
Defendant appeared in person; Pro se

Pre-trial conference at 12-07-2015 08:35 am.
Plea hearing at 12-21-2015 01:40 pm.
Final pre-trial at 01-21-2016 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 02-11-2016 09:00 am.
